availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Ada Stark Harding in Sumner County, Tennessee, in July 1827. Father of Thomas Harding, Addison Harding, James E. Harding, William H. Harding, Sally A. Harding, Elizabeth Harding, Albert Harding, and Mary F. Harding. Farmer in Calloway County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1850. Farmer in Calloway County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 467A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 1, p. 855.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 191-2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 228A.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Sumner County, 1820 - 1829: Marriages 3, p. 751.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Calloway County Wills, vol. D-G, 1885-1961, p. 55.
